abstract: Google will unveil communications and productivity software aimed at businesses that will be accessible over the Internet.
snippet: Google will unveil communications and productivity software aimed at businesses that will be accessible over the Internet.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, Feb. 21 — Google is taking aim at one of Microsoft’s most lucrative franchises.

abstract: The Microsoft Wireless Entertainment Desktop 7000 combines a Bluetooth keyboard and a rechargeable mouse.
snippet: The Microsoft Wireless Entertainment Desktop 7000 combines a Bluetooth keyboard and a rechargeable mouse.
lead_paragraph: Microsoft finally got its Windows Vista software out the door. Now comes the hardware.

headline.main: How About a Mouse and Keyboard to Go With That Vista?
headline.print_headline: How About a Mouse and Keyboard to Go With That Vista?

abstract: Sony bought video-sharing Web site Grouper in August. Google picked up YouTube, the king of video sites, in October. Now comes a report that Microsoft has taken a look at Revver, yet another venture-backed video-sharing startup. CNET News.com reports that executives from Microsoft toured Revver’s Los Angeles headquarters last month to determine whether that company’s service could enhance Soapbox, Microsoft’s own, newly launched service.
lead_paragraph: Sony bought video-sharing Web site Grouper in August. Google picked up YouTube, the king of video sites, in October. Now comes a report that Microsoft has taken a look at Revver, yet another venture-backed video-sharing startup. CNET News.com reports that executives from Microsoft toured Revver’s Los Angeles headquarters last month to determine whether that company’s service could enhance Soapbox, Microsoft’s own, newly launched service.
